schema.description: Borrows funds to reach the desired loan-to-value ratio and sends the borrowed funds to the given recipient.

desired_ltv_ratio.description: A fixed-point decimal value with 18 fractional digits, i.e. Decimal256(1_000_000_000_000_000_000) == 1.0 The greatest possible value that can be represented is 115792089237316195423570985008687907853269984665640564039457.584007913129639935 (which is (2^128 - 1) / 10^18)
desired_ltv_ratio.title: desired_ltv_ratio

oneOf.description: An address that is not another ADO. It is assumed that it is a valid address.

a_d_o.description: ADOs use a default Receive message for handling funds, this struct states that the recipient is an ADO and may attach the data field to the Receive message

address.description: Addr can also be a human-readable identifier used in a mission contract.

identifier.description: Can be either an address or identifier of an ADO in a mission.

anyOf.description:
Binary is a wrapper around Vec<u8> to add base64 de/serialization with serde. It also adds some helper methods to help encode inline.

This is only needed as serde-json-{core,wasm} has a horrible encoding for Vec<u8>
